required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Assessing Efficacy of Brivaracetam in Subjects With Persistent Pain After Shingles (Post-herpetic Neuralgia)
clinical_study.official_title: An Exploratory, Double Blind, Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Parallel Group, Multicenter Study, for the Assessment of Efficacy, Safety and Tolerability of Ucb 34714 50 mg Oral Capsules in b.i.d. Administration at the Doses of 200 mg/Day and 400 mg/Day, in Subjects (at Least 18 Years Old) Suffering From Post Herpetic Neuralgia (PHN)

brief_summary.textblock: Study will assess efficacy, safety and tolerability of brivaracetam in post-herpetic neuralgia (PHN). Duration of 7 weeks divided into 3 periods with no up-titration, nor down-titration.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage Change in Average Pain Intensity Score From Baseline to the Last Week of the 4-week Treatment Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, last week of the 4-week Treatment Period
primary_outcome.description: Pain intensity was scored on a 11-point numeric pain rating scale, ranging from 0 to 10 where 0= no pain and 10= worst possible pain. A negative value in percent change from Baseline indicates a decrease in average pain intensity score from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Responder Rate in Average Pain Intensity Score at the Last Week of the Treatment Period Compared to the Baseline Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, last week of the 4-week Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: A responder is defined as a subject with a >= 30 % reduction in average pain intensity score at the Evaluation Week (last week of the Treatment Period) compared to the Baseline Period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From the Baseline Period to Each Weekly Mean in the Pain Intensity Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, each Evaluation visit (up to Week 4)
secondary_outcome.description: Pain intensity was scored on a 11-point numeric pain rating scale, ranging from 0 to 10 where 0= no pain and 10= worst possible pain. A negative value in percent change from Baseline indicates a decrease in average pain intensity score from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From the Baseline Period to the Last Week of the Treatment Period in the Sleep Interference Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, last assessment during the 4-week Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.description: Sleep interference was scored on a 11-point numerical sleep interference rating scale, ranging from 0 to 10 where 0 = 'pain does not interfere with sleep', 10 = 'pain completely interferes with sleep'. A negative value in percent change from Baseline indicates a decrease in average sleep interference score from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From the Baseline Period to Each Weekly Mean of the Treatment Period in the Sleep Interference Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, each Evaluation visit (up to Week 4)
secondary_outcome.description: Sleep interference was scored on a 11-point numerical sleep interference rating scale, ranging from 0 to 10 where 0 = 'pain does not interfere with sleep', 10 = 'pain completely interferes with sleep'. A negative value in percent change from Baseline indicates a decrease in average sleep interference score from Baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From the Randomization Visit to the Evaluation / Early Discontinuation Visit in the Total Pain Score of the Short-Form McGill Pain Questionnaire (SF-MPQ)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization visit, Evaluation / Early Discontinuation visit (up to Week 4)
secondary_outcome.description: The SF-MPQ has three components: the first one consists of 15 subscales (descriptors: 11 sensory, 4 affective) which are rated on an intensity scale with 0 = none, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate or 3 = severe. Three pain scores are derived from the sum of the intensity rank values of the words chosen for sensory, affective and total subscales (descriptors). The SF-MPQ also includes a Present Pain Intensity (PPI) index and a visual analogue scale (VAS). Each of the 15 subscales is rated from 0=none to 3=severe pain. The Total Pain Score of the SF-MPQ is the sum of all 15 ratings and can hence vary from 0 (15*0=0: no pain) to 60 (15*4=60: severe pain). The mean change in total score is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From the Randomization Visit to the Evaluation / Early Discontinuation Visit in the Sensory Score of the Short-Form McGill Pain Questionnaire (SF-MPQ)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization visit, Evaluation / Early Discontinuation visit (up to Week 4)
secondary_outcome.description: The main component of the SF-MPQ consists of 15 descriptors (11 sensory; 4 affective) which are rated on an intensity scale as 0 = none, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate or 3 = severe. The sensory score ranges from 0 to 33. Change = observation mean at Evaluation / Early Discontinuation visit minus Randomization mean. A negative value in absolute change indicates an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From the Randomization Visit to the Evaluation / Early Discontinuation Visit in the Affective Score of the Short-Form McGill Pain Questionnaire (SF-MPQ)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization visit, Evaluation / Early Discontinuation visit (up to Week 4)
secondary_outcome.description: The main component of the SF-MPQ consists of 15 descriptors (11 sensory; 4 affective) which are rated on an intensity scale as 0 = none, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate or 3 = severe. The affective score ranges from 0 to 12. Change = observation mean at Evaluation / Early Discontinuation visit minus Randomization mean. A negative value in absolute change indicates an improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From the Randomization Visit to the Evaluation / Early Discontinuation Visit in the Present Pain Intensity (PPI) Score of the SF-MPQ
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization visit, Evaluation / Early Discontinuation visit (up to Week 4)
secondary_outcome.description: Present pain intensity (PPI) was rated by the subject. The score ranges from 0 (no pain) to 5 (excruciating). A negative value in absolute change indicates an improvement in PPI.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change From the Randomization Visit to the Evaluation / Early Discontinuation Visit in the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) of the SF-MPQ
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization visit, Evaluation / Early Discontinuation visit (up to Week 4)
secondary_outcome.description: Pain burden was rated by the subject using the visual analog scale (VAS) ranging from 0 (no pain) to 100 (worst possible pain). A negative value in absolute change indicates an improvement in pain burden.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Categorized Change in Pain Assessed by Patient's Global Evaluation Scale at the Evaluation / Early Discontinuation Visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization visit, Evaluation / Early Discontinuation visit (up to Week 4)
secondary_outcome.description: Patient´s global assessment of change in pain was performed using a seven-point scale (7= Marked improvement, 6= Moderate improvement, 5= Slight improvement, 4= No change, 3= Slight worsening, 2= Moderate worsening, 1= Marked worsening).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects With Categorized Change in Post-herpetic Neuralgia Assessed by Investigator's Global Evaluation Scale at the Evaluation / Early Discontinuation Visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization visit, Evaluation / Early Discontinuation visit (up to Week 4)
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator´s global assessment of change was performed using a seven-point scale (7= Marked improvement, 6= Moderate improvement, 5= Slight improvement, 4= No change, 3= Slight worsening, 2= Moderate worsening, 1= Marked worsening).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Randomization Visit to the Evaluation / Early Discontinuation in the Brush-evoked Allodynia Intensity Rated by the Patient
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization visit, Evaluation / Early Discontinuation visit (up to Week 4)
secondary_outcome.description: Brush-evoked allodynia intensity was assessed by the subject on an 11-point numerical rating scale, ranging from 0= no pain to 10= unbearable Pain. A negative value in percent change indicates an improvement in brush-evoked allodynia intensity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Randomization Visit to the Evaluation / Early Discontinuation in the Brush-evoked Allodynia Area Measured by the Investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization visit, Evaluation / Early Discontinuation visit (up to Week 4)
secondary_outcome.description: Allodynia is pain due to a normally non-painful stimulus. The brush-evoked allodynia areas were assessed by the Investigator (location and contour of the allodynic regions drawn on a standard dermatomal map). Areas (mm²) of the allodynic regions drawn by the Investigator were afterwards computed by means of appropriate tools and calibrated templates. The larger the area in square centimeters the more allodynia. A negative value in percent change in the brush-evoked allodynia area indicates improvement.

arm_group.description: Matching placebo tablets administered twice a day.
Brivaracetam 200 mg/day (100 mg administered twice a day).
Brivaracetam 400 mg/day (200 mg administered twice a day).

intervention.description: Daily oral dose of two equal intakes.
Daily oral dose of two equal intakes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male/female subject aged 18 years or older.
- Pain present for at least 6 months after healing of the acute herpes zoster skin rash.
- Pain intensity score assessed on an 11-point numerical pain rating scale with a score of at least 4 at the screening visit and with an average weekly score of at least 4 on an 11-point numerical pain rating scale during baseline period.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject getting any kind of psychological support to help cope with pain such as biofeedback or behavioral cognitive therapy.
- Subject who had undergone or who is scheduled for neurolytic or neurosurgical therapy for post-herpetic neuralgia (PHN) or who receives trans-electrical neural stimulation (TENS.
- Tricyclic antidepressants (TCAs) or non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAIDs) or permitted opioid analgesics ('strong' opioids are forbidden) that started less than 30 days and/or are not stabilized prior to screening and/or are not expected to be kept stable during the study.
- Intake of more than two pain treatments at trial entry (screening visit) including Tricyclic antidepressants (TCAs), non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) or permitted opioid analgesics.
- Subject being treated with Carbamazepine for any indication.
- Known coexistent source of painful peripheral neuropathy or other systemic disease associated with a secondary painful neuropathy.
- Subject being treated in the four weeks prior to screening visit with 'strong' opioid analgesics.
Exclusion Criteria:

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study started to enroll patients in October 2004 and concluded in January 2006.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participant Flow refers to the Randomized Set.

analysis.estimate_desc: Estimated value is the difference of Least Square Means.
Estimated value is the difference of Least Square Means.

measure.title: Responder Rate in Average Pain Intensity Score at the Last Week of the Treatment Period Compared to the Baseline Period
measure.description: A responder is defined as a subject with a >= 30 % reduction in average pain intensity score at the Evaluation Week (last week of the Treatment Period) compared to the Baseline Period.
measure.population: Only subjects with valid data for average pain intensity score at Baseline and the last week of the 4-week Treatment Period are included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Percent Change From the Baseline Period to Each Weekly Mean in the Pain Intensity Score
outcome.description: Pain intensity was scored on a 11-point numeric pain rating scale, ranging from 0 to 10 where 0= no pain and 10= worst possible pain. A negative value in percent change from Baseline indicates a decrease in average pain intensity score from Baseline.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, each Evaluation visit (up to Week 4)
outcome.population: Intention-To-Treat set included 50 subjects treated with Placebo, 51 subjects treated with brivaracetam (BRV) 200 mg/day, 51 subjects treated with BRV 400 mg/day. Only subjects with valid data for pain intensity score at the respective visit (week) are included in the analysis. Number of participants analyzed is given separately per visit (week).

outcome.title: Absolute Change From the Randomization Visit to the Evaluation / Early Discontinuation Visit in the Total Pain Score of the Short-Form McGill Pain Questionnaire (SF-MPQ)
outcome.description: The SF-MPQ has three components: the first one consists of 15 subscales (descriptors: 11 sensory, 4 affective) which are rated on an intensity scale with 0 = none, 1 = mild, 2 = moderate or 3 = severe. Three pain scores are derived from the sum of the intensity rank values of the words chosen for sensory, affective and total subscales (descriptors). The SF-MPQ also includes a Present Pain Intensity (PPI) index and a visual analogue scale (VAS). Each of the 15 subscales is rated from 0=none to 3=severe pain. The Total Pain Score of the SF-MPQ is the sum of all 15 ratings and can hence vary from 0 (15*0=0: no pain) to 60 (15*4=60: severe pain). The mean change in total score is reported.
outcome.time_frame: Randomization visit, Evaluation / Early Discontinuation visit (up to Week 4)
outcome.population: Only subjects having values at randomization and at evaluation (V5) / early discontinuation are included.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo tablets administered twice a day.

group.title: Brivaracetam 200 mg/Day
group.description: Brivaracetam 200 mg/day (100 mg administered twice a day).

group.title: Brivaracetam 400 mg/Day
group.description: Brivaracetam 400 mg/day (200 mg administered twice a day).

measure.title: Percent Change From Randomization Visit to the Evaluation / Early Discontinuation in the Brush-evoked Allodynia Intensity Rated by the Patient
measure.description: Brush-evoked allodynia intensity was assessed by the subject on an 11-point numerical rating scale, ranging from 0= no pain to 10= unbearable Pain. A negative value in percent change indicates an improvement in brush-evoked allodynia intensity.
measure.population: Only subjects with valid data at the Evaluation / Early Discontinuation visit are included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Percent Change From Randomization Visit to the Evaluation / Early Discontinuation in the Brush-evoked Allodynia Area Measured by the Investigator
outcome.description: Allodynia is pain due to a normally non-painful stimulus. The brush-evoked allodynia areas were assessed by the Investigator (location and contour of the allodynic regions drawn on a standard dermatomal map). Areas (mm²) of the allodynic regions drawn by the Investigator were afterwards computed by means of appropriate tools and calibrated templates. The larger the area in square centimeters the more allodynia. A negative value in percent change in the brush-evoked allodynia area indicates improvement.
outcome.time_frame: Randomization visit, Evaluation / Early Discontinuation visit (up to Week 4)
outcome.population: Only subjects with valid data at the Evaluation / Early Discontinuation visit are included in the analysis.

measure.description: Allodynia is pain due to a normally non-painful stimulus. The brush-evoked allodynia areas were assessed by the Investigator (location and contour of the allodynic regions drawn on a standard dermatomal map). Areas (mm²) of the allodynic regions drawn by the Investigator were afterwards computed by means of appropriate tools and calibrated templates. The larger the area in square centimeters the more allodynia. A negative value in percent change in the brush-evoked allodynia area indicates improvement.
measure.population: Only subjects with valid data at the Evaluation / Early Discontinuation visit are included in the analysis.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse Events were collected from first intake of randomized study medication until Final Visit (Week 6)
reported_events.desc: Adverse Events refer to the Safety Population consisting of all subjects who were dispensed medication.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Matching placebo tablets administered twice a day.

group.title: Brivaracetam 200 mg/Day
group.description: Brivaracetam 200 mg/day (100 mg administered twice a day).

group.description: Brivaracetam 400 mg/day (200 mg administered twice a day).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
